channel.title: Mannahatta on Lunaapahkiing Princeton Timetree

item.title: Mannahatta
item.description: In 1624, the Dutch colonize the southern tip of Manhattan Island and establish a trading post, which becomes New Amsterdam, and later, New York City. The fur trade booms. Manhattan, or Mannahatta, is a Munsee Lunaape word for the “bow-gathering place.” 1916 redraft of the Castello Plan, a 1660 map of New Amsterdam. The east-west land barrier (running top-to-bottom on the map) is the border wall after which Wall Street is named.
